abstract.text: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations in pp collisions at ffiffi ffi s p ¼ 7 TeV using the CMS detector at the CERN LHC are presented.
The analysis is based on an inclusive dijet event sample corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 2:9 pb À1 .
The results are compared to predictions from perturbative QCD calculations and various Monte Carlo event generators.
The dijet azimuthal distributions are found to be sensitive to initial-state gluon radiation.

body_text.text: High-energy proton-proton collisions with high momentum transfer are described within the framework of quantum chromodynamics (QCD) as pointlike scatterings between the proton constituents, collectively referred to as partons.
The outgoing partons manifest themselves, through quark and gluon soft radiation and hadronization processes, as localized streams of particles, identified as jets.

At Born level, dijets are produced with equal transverse momenta p T with respect to the beam axis and back to back in the azimuthal angle (Á' dijet ¼ j' jet1 À ' jet2 j ¼ ). Soft-gluon emission will decorrelate the two highest p T (leading) jets and cause small deviations from . Larger decorrelations from occur in the case of hard multijet production. Threejet topologies dominate the region of 2=3 < Á' dijet < , whereas angles smaller than 2=3 are populated by four-jet events.

Dijet azimuthal decorrelations, i.e., the deviation of Á' dijet from for the two leading jets in hard-scattering events, can be used to study QCD radiation effects over a wide range of jet multiplicities without the need to measure all the additional jets.
Such studies are important because an accurate description of multiple-parton radiation is still lacking in perturbative QCD (pQCD).
Experiments therefore rely on Monte Carlo (MC) event generators to take these higher-order processes into account in searches for new physics and for a wide variety of precision measurements.

The observable chosen to study the radiation effects is the differential dijet cross section in Á' dijet , normalized by the dijet cross section integrated over the entire Á' dijet phase space: ð1= dijet Þðd dijet =dÁ' dijet Þ.
By normalizing the Á' dijet distributions in this manner, many experimental and theoretical uncertainties are significantly reduced.
Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0
Collaboration [1].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: In this Letter, we present the first measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations in pp collisions at ffiffi ffi s p ¼ 7 TeV at the CERN Large Hadron Collider (LHC).
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The central feature of the Compact Muon Solenoid (CMS) apparatus is a superconducting solenoid, of 6 m internal diameter, providing an axial field of 3.8 T. Charged particle trajectories are measured by the silicon pixel and strip tracker, covering 0 < ' < 2 in azimuth and jj < 2:5, where pseudorapidity ¼ À ln½tanð=2Þ and is the polar angle relative to the counterclockwise proton beam direction with respect to the center of the detector. A lead-tungstate crystal electromagnetic calorimeter and a brass-scintillator hadronic calorimeter surround the tracking volume. The calorimeter cells are grouped in projective towers of granularity Á Â Á' ¼ 0:087 Â 0:087 at central pseudorapidities.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The granularity becomes coarser at forward pseudorapidities.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: A preshower detector made of silicon sensor planes and lead absorbers is installed in front of the electromagnetic calorimeter at 1:653 < jj < 2:6.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Muons are measured in gas-ionization detectors embedded in the steel magnetic field return yoke.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: CMS uses a two-tiered trigger system to select events on-line: level 1 and the high level trigger.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: In this analysis, events were selected by using two inclusive single-jet triggers that required a level-1 jet with p T > 20 (30) GeV and a high level trigger jet with p T > 30 (50) GeV.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The jets at level 1 and the high level trigger are reconstructed by using energies measured by the electromagnetic and hadronic calorimeters and are not corrected for the jet energy response of the calorimeters.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The trigger efficiency for a given corrected p T threshold of the leading jet (p T max ) was measured by using events selected by a lower-threshold trigger.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: For the event selection, p T max thresholds were chosen so that this efficiency exceeded 99%.

body_text.text: The four-vectors of particles reconstructed by the CMS particle-flow algorithm were used as input to the jetclustering algorithm.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The particle-flow algorithm combines information from all CMS subdetectors to provide a complete list of long-lived particles in the event.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Muons, electrons, photons, and charged and neutral hadrons are reconstructed individually.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: As a result, the residual corrections to the jet four-vectors, arising from the detector response, are relatively small (at the level of 5%-10% in the central region) [4].

body_text.text: A detailed description of the particleflow algorithm can be found elsewhere [5,6].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Spurious jets from noise and noncollision backgrounds were eliminated by applying loose quality cuts on the jet properties [7].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Events were required to have a primary vertex reconstructed along the beam axis and within 24 cm of the detector center [8].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Further cuts were applied to reject interactions from the beam halo.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Events were selected having two leading jets each with p T > 30 GeV and rapidity jyj < 1:1, where y ¼ 1 2 ln½ðE þ p z Þ=ðE À p z Þ, with E being the total jet energy and p z the projection of the jet momentum along the beam axis.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Each event is put into one of five mutually exclusive regions, which are based on the p T max in the event.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The five regions are 80
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: max < 300 GeV, and 300 GeV < p T max .
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The data correspond to an integrated luminosity of 0:3 pb À1 for the lowest p T max region and 2:9 pb À1 for the other p T max regions.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The uncertainty on the integrated luminosity is estimated to be 11% [9].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: After the application of all selection criteria, the numbers of events remaining in each of the five p T max regions, starting from the lowest, are 60 837, 160 388, 69 009, 14 383, and 2284.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The Á' dijet distributions are corrected for event migration effects due to the finite jet p T and position resolutions of the detector.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The distributions are sensitive to the jet p T resolution because fluctuations in the jet response can cause low-energy jets to be misidentified as leading jets, and events can migrate between different p T max regions.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The finite resolution in azimuthal angle causes event migration between Á' dijet bins, while the resolution in rapidity can move jets in and out of the central rapidity region (jyj < 1:1).
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The correction factors were determined by using two independent MC samples: PYTHIA 6.422 (PYTHIA6) [10] tune D6T [11], and HERWIGþþ 2.4.2 [12].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The p T , rapidity, and azimuthal angle of each generated jet were smeared according to the measured resolutions [13].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The ratio of the two dijet azimuthal distributions (the generated distribution and the smeared one) determined the unfolding correction factors for each p T max region, for a given MC sample.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The average of the correction factors for each p T max region from the two MC samples was used as the final unfolding correction applied to the data.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The unfolding correction factors modify the measured Á' dijet distributions by less than 2% for 5=6 < Á' dijet < .
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: For Á' dijet $ =2, the changes range from À11%, for the highest p T max region, to À19%, for the lowest.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The main sources of systematic uncertainty arise from uncertainties in the jet energy calibration, the jet p T resolution, and the unfolding correction.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The jet energy calibration uncertainties have been tabulated for the considered phase space in the variables of jet p T and [4].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Typical values are between 2.5% and 3.5%.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The resulting uncertainties on the normalized Á' dijet distributions range from 5% at Á' dijet $ =2 to 1% at Á' dijet $ .
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The effect of the jet p T resolution uncertainty on the Á' dijet distributions was estimated by varying the jet p T resolutions by AE10% [13] and comparing the Á' dijet unfolding correction before and after the change.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: This yields a variation on the normalized Á' dijet distributions ranging from 5% at Á' dijet $ =2 to 1% at Á' dijet $ .
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The uncertainties on the unfolding correction factors were estimated by comparing the corrections from different event generators and PYTHIA6 tunes that vary significantly in their modeling of the jet kinematic distributions and Á' dijet distributions.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The resulting uncertainty varies from 8% at Á' dijet $ =2 to 1.5% at Á' dijet $ .
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The systematic uncertainty from using a parametrized model to simulate the finite jet p T and position resolutions of the detector to determine the unfolding correction factors was estimated to be about 2.5% in all p T max regions.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The combined systematic uncertainty, calculated as the quadratic sum of all systematic uncertainties, varies from 11% at Á' dijet $ =2 to 3% at Á' dijet $ .

body_text.text: Each data point is plotted at the abscissa value for which the predicted differential Á' dijet distribution has the same value as the bin average obtained by using PYTHIA6 tune D6T, which provides a good description of the data [14].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The Á' dijet distributions are strongly peaked at and become steeper with increasing p T max .
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The simulated Á' dijet distributions from the PYTHIA6 (D6T and Z2 [15] tunes), PYTHIA 8.135 (PYTHIA8) [16], HERWIGþ þ, and MADGRAPH 4.4.32 [17] event generators are presented for comparison.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The MADGRAPH generator is based on leadingorder matrix element multiparton final-state predictions, using PYTHIA6 for parton showering and hadronization, and the Mangano method [18] to map the parton-level event into a parton shower history.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The MADGRAPH predictions included tree-level processes of up to four partons.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: For PYTHIA6, PYTHIA8, and MADGRAPH event generators the CTEQ6L [19] parton distribution functions (PDFs) were used; for HERWIGþ þ, the MRST2001 PDFs [20].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Figure 2 shows the ratios of the measured Á' dijet distributions to the predictions of PYTHIA6, PYTHIA8, HERWIGþ þ, and MADGRAPH in the five p T max regions.

body_text.text: The predictions from PYTHIA6 and HERWIGþþ describe the shape of the data distributions well, while MADGRAPH (PYTHIA8) predicts less (more) azimuthal decorrelation than is observed in the data.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The PDF uncertainties were derived by using the 22 CTEQ6.6 uncertainty eigenvectors and found to be 9% at Á' dijet $ =2 and 2% at Á' dijet < .

body_text.text: Following the proposal of the PDF4LHC working group [23], the impact of other global PDF fits [24][25][26] was investigated and found to be negligible in the context of this analysis.

body_text.text: The correction factors were determined from the PYTHIA6 and HERWIGþþ simulations and modify the predictions from þ4% (Á' dijet $ ) to À13% (Á' dijet $ =2).

body_text.text: The uncertainty due to the nonperturbative corrections is estimated to be 6% at Á' dijet $ =2 and 2% at Á' dijet $ .

body_text.text: Compared to the data, the reduced decorrelation in the theoretical prediction and the increased sensitivity to the r and f scale variations for Á' dijet < 2=3 shown in Fig. 3 are attributed to the fact that the pQCD prediction in this region is effectively available only at leading order, since the contribution from tree-level four-parton final states dominates.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The sensitivity of the Á' dijet distributions to initial-state parton shower radiation (ISR) is investigated by varying the input parameter k ISR [PARP(67)] in PYTHIA6 tune D6T.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The product of k ISR and the square of the hard-scattering scale gives the maximum allowed parton virtuality (i.e., the maximum allowed p T ) in the initial-state shower.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Previous studies have shown that k ISR is the only parameter in PYTHIA6 that has significant impact on the Á' dijet distributions [27].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The default value of k ISR in PYTHIA6 tune D6T is 2.5, determined from the D0 dijet azimuthal decorrelation results [1].
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Figure 4 shows comparisons of the measured Á' dijet distributions to PYTHIA6 distributions with various k ISR values.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The effects are more pronounced for smaller Á' dijet angles, where multigluon radiation dominates.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: Varying k ISR by AE0:5 about its default value yields a change of about 30% on the PYTHIA6 prediction for Á' dijet $ =2, suggesting that our results could be used to tune parameters in the MC event generators that control radiative effects in the initial state.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: In PYTHIA6 tune D6T, the maximum p T allowed in the final-state radiation parton shower is controlled through the parameter PARP(71).
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: We varied the value of this parameter from 2.5 to 8 (the default value is 4.0) and observed less than $10% changes in the Á' dijet distributions in all p T regions.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: In summary, we have measured dijet azimuthal decorrelations in different leading-jet p T regions from pp collisions at ffiffi ffi s p ¼ 7 TeV.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The PYTHIA6 and HERWIGþþ event generators are found to best describe the shape of the measured distributions over the entire range of Á' dijet .
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The predictions from NLO pQCD are in reasonable agreement with the measured distributions, except at small Á' dijet where multiparton radiation effects dominate.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0

body_text.text: The Á' dijet distributions are found to be sensitive to initial-state gluon radiation.
body_text.section: Measurements of dijet azimuthal decorrelations at the Tevatron have previously been reported by the D0
